name: emi.blah
description: BLAHPD is a light component accepting commands according to the BLAH (Batch Local Ascii Helper) protocol to manage jobs on different Local Resources Management Systems (LRMS). The BLAH service provides a minimal, pragmatically designed common interface for job submission and control to a set of batch systems. Interaction with BLAH is achieved via text commands whose syntax and semantics is described below. Interaction with each one of the various supported batch system is achieved via customized scripts
releaseNotes:
What's new

    This updates of BLAH fixes a problem with the new BLparser that can happen under high load.

    It also addresses an issue with the new BLParser with LSF: bhist is not used anymore and therefore the load caused by the bupdater is much lower than before.

    This new BLAH version also enables the submissions to Torque version 2.5.8



Affected services

    CREAM



Deployment Notes:

    Since BLAH is deployed together with CREAM, please refer to the installation and configuration notes for the whole CREAM-CE



Known issues

    Please refer to the CREAM known issues page:

http://wiki.italiangrid.org/twiki/bin/view/CREAM/KnownIssues





Documentation changes

---------------------

None (but moved to different locations wrt previous version)
